faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common questions about our services and immigration process.
faq.noResults: No results found for your search.

immigration.q1: What are the requirements for a work visa?
immigration.a1: Work visa requirements vary by country but typically include a valid job offer, proof of qualifications, a valid passport, and sometimes a medical examination. Our team can guide you through the specific requirements for your destination country.
immigration.q2: How long does the immigration process take?
immigration.a2: The immigration process timeline varies significantly depending on the country, visa type, and individual circumstances. Generally, it can take anywhere from 3 months to 2 years. During your consultation, we can provide a more accurate timeline based on your specific situation.
immigration.q3: Can my family accompany me when immigrating?
immigration.a3: Yes, in most cases, your spouse and dependent children can accompany you when immigrating. Family reunification is a priority in many immigration systems. We can help you navigate the application process for family members.

formation.q1: What training courses do you offer?
formation.a1: We offer a variety of training courses including language preparation (IELTS, TOEFL, TEF), professional certification preparation, and industry-specific training programs. Our courses are tailored to support your immigration and career development goals.
formation.q2: Are your training courses recognized internationally?
formation.a2: Yes, our training courses are designed to meet international standards and are recognized by employers and immigration authorities worldwide. We partner with accredited institutions to ensure the quality and recognition of our training programs.

coaching.a1: Our career coaching service includes personalized guidance on career planning, skills assessment, resume building, interview preparation, and networking strategies. We work with you to develop a tailored plan that aligns with your professional goals and the job market in your target country.
coaching.q2: How many coaching sessions will I need?
coaching.a2: The number of coaching sessions varies based on individual needs and goals. Some clients achieve their objectives in 3-5 sessions, while others benefit from ongoing support. After an initial assessment, we can recommend a coaching plan that suits your specific situation.

orientation.q1: How can professional orientation help my career?
orientation.a1: Professional orientation helps you identify your strengths, skills, and interests, and aligns them with suitable career paths. This service is particularly valuable when considering a career change, moving to a new country, or seeking advancement in your current field.
orientation.q2: What assessments do you use for professional orientation?
orientation.a2: We use a combination of standardized assessments, personality inventories, skills tests, and in-depth interviews to provide a comprehensive understanding of your professional profile. Our approach is evidence-based and tailored to your unique situation.

recruitment.q1: Which industries do you specialize in for recruitment?
recruitment.a1: We specialize in recruitment for healthcare, information technology, engineering, education, and hospitality sectors. These industries frequently have international demand and offer good opportunities for skilled migrants.
recruitment.q2: How do you match candidates with job opportunities?
recruitment.a2: We match candidates based on a comprehensive assessment of skills, experience, qualifications, and career goals, as well as cultural fit and immigration feasibility. Our extensive employer network and market knowledge allow us to identify suitable opportunities that align with your profile.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.introText: Welcome to MigraPro's Privacy Policy. We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting the personal information you provide to us. This policy explains how we collect, use, disclose and protect your information when you use our services.
privacy.infoCollectedText: We may collect the following types of information:
infoCollectedItems: Personal information: name, address, email, phone number
Identification information: copies of passport, visa, work permit
Professional information: CV, employment history, qualifications
Financial information: bank statements, proof of funds
Navigation data: IP address, browser type, pages visited
privacy.infoUseText: We use your personal information to:
infoUseItems: Provide our immigration consulting, training and recruitment services
Prepare and submit immigration applications on your behalf
Contact you regarding your case or our services
Improve our services and your user experience
Comply with legal and regulatory obligations
privacy.infoSharingText: We do not sell your personal information to third parties. We may share your information with:
infoSharingItems: Immigration and government authorities as part of your application
Our service partners who help us provide our services
Legal experts or consultants involved in your case
privacy.dataSecurityText: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, modification, disclosure or destruction. However, no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure.
privacy.dataRetentionText: We retain your personal information for as long as necessary for the purposes for which it was collected, including to satisfy any legal, accounting, or reporting requirements.
privacy.yourRightsText: Depending on your place of residence, you may have the right to:
yourRightsItems: Access the personal information we hold about you
Restrict or object to the processing of your information
Request the portability of your data
privacy.policyChangesText: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. The most recent version will always be available on our website with the effective date.
